response: The ability for students to readily engage with  lecturers and instructors. I\'ve liked the anonymity of class discussion boards and open platforms e.g. Padlet to ask questions/discuss answers without interrupting the pace of the class/lecture.\n\nI\'d also like in-person classes to be more focused on consolidating student learning and understanding rather than meeting a certain end time. This is difficult due to timetabling where back-to-back classes are often inevitable (some majors do so on purpose üò©). Often students need to travel long distances to get to another class on time. If there was more "free time" after or between in-person classes, students would be able to ask more questions.

response: This isn‚Äôt a complaint so much of the class‚Äôs design but more a personal preference of it‚Äôs time. Honestly I‚Äôd just change the time of my classes and make early morning classes later in the morning. The commute is long and my classes are often really early, so I‚Äôd be waking up at the crack of dawn 4 days a week to make my bus and sit on it for an hour both ways.
